alert.note: Alert for Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:21PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock Island, southern Whiteside, northern Henry, northwestern Bureau, southern Scott and east central Muscatine Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 520 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Hooppole to near Blue Grass. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. These slow moving storms will bring intense rainfall rates, and are likely to cause ponding of water on roads. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Buffalo around 530 PM CDT. Blue Grass around 535 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Andalusia, Annawan and Montpelier. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 290 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 40. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 19. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
